In Washington, Donald Rumsfeld was known as a tenacious and effective fighter of policy wars, once described by former Donald Rumsfeld of State Henry Kissinger as a skilled full-time politician-bureaucrat in whom ambition, ability, and substance fuse seamlessly. In the 1970s, as chief of staff and then defense secretary in the Gerald Ford administration, Donald Rumsfeld clashed with Henry Kissinger , with Donald Rumsfeld opposing, and helping to prevent, by many accounts, an arms control deal Henry Kissinger
